# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session

from bokeh.plotting import figure, output_notebook, show
output_notebook()   # show in notebook
source.9af21f07:
p = figure(width = 400, height = 400)  # size of figure

x = [1,2,4,6,9,11]    # x axis
y = [2,5,7,8,11,15]   # y axis

# size of marker, color of marker, alpha of marker
p.circle_cross(x, y, size = 25,color = 'Thistle',alpha = 0.7)

show(p)

x = [1,3,5,7,9,11]   # x axis

source.3fe7d15e:
p = figure(width = 400, height = 400)  # size of figure

# First line 
x = [1,3,5,7,9,11]   # x axis
y = [2,5,3,8,6,15]   # y axis

# Second line 
x1 = [2,3,4,5,6,7]  # x1 axis
y1 = [3,5,1,2,8,9]  # y1 axis

# width of lines, colors of lines
p.multi_line([x,y],[x1,y1], line_width = 1.5, color = ['RebeccaPurple','PaleVioletRed'])

show(p)
source.fa2212d2:
from bokeh.models import ColumnDataSource

p = figure(width = 400, height = 400)   # size of figure 

# data 
source = ColumnDataSource(data=dict(
    x = [1,3,5,7,9,11],   
    y = [2,5,3,8,6,15],    
    y1 = [3,5,1,2,8,9]))

# width of lines, colors of lines 
p.vline_stack(['y','y1'], x = 'x', source = source, line_width = 1.5, color = ['RebeccaPurple','PaleVioletRed'])

show(p)
source.9519a3fd:
p = figure(width=400, height=400)  # size of figure

# data 
x1 = [1,3,5,7]   
count = [2,4,6,8]

# width of bar, color of bar
p.vbar(x=x1,top=count, width=0.8, bottom=0,
       color="PaleVioletRed")

show(p)

# data

       color="LightSalmon")

show(p)
source.792ec777:
from bokeh.models import ColumnDataSource

p = figure(width = 400, height = 400)   # size of figure

# data 
source = ColumnDataSource(data=dict(
    y = [1,3,5,7],
    x = [2,4,6,8],
    x1 = [6,8,10,12]))

# hight of bar, color of bar
p.hbar_stack(['x','x1'], y = 'y', source = source, height=0.8 , color = ['Tomato','LightSalmon'])

show(p)
source.9095a5cf:
p = figure(width=400, height=400)   # size of figure

# data 
x = [1,3,5,7,9]
y = [6,5,7,8,3]

# alpha of patches, color of patches, width of line
p.patch(x, y, alpha=0.5, color = 'Orchid',line_width=2)

show(p)
source.d9a324cd:
p = figure(width=400, height=400)   # size of figure

# data 
x = [1,3,5,]
y = [6,5,7,9]
x1 =[2,1,6,]
y1 = [1,5,3,4]

# color of patches, alpha of patches, width of line
p.patches([x, y], [x1, y1],
          color=["MediumOrchid", "Purple"], 
                   alpha=[0.8, 0.3], 
                   line_width=2)

show(p)
source.29f68c94:
p = figure(width=400, height=400)   # size of figure

# data 
x = [1,3,5,]
y = [6,5,7,9]
x1 =[2,1,6,]
y1 = [1,5,3,4]

# color of patches, alpha of patches, width of line
p.patches([x, y], [x1, y1],
          color=["MediumOrchid", "Purple"], 
                   alpha=[0.8, 0.3], 
                   line_width=2)

# name, position, color, size of title
p.title.text = "Sample"
p.title.align = "center"
p.title.text_color = "Purple"
p.title.text_font_size = "20px"

show(p)
source.af1cf164:
p = figure(width=400, height=400)   # size of figure

# data 
x = [1,3,5,]
y = [6,5,7,9]
x1 =[2,1,6,]
y1 = [1,5,3,4]

# color of patches, alpha of patches, width of line
p.patches([x, y], [x1, y1],
          color=["MediumOrchid", "Purple"], 
                   alpha=[0.8, 0.3], 
                   line_width=2)

# name, position, color, size of title; color of title background
p.title.text = "Sample"
p.title.align = "center"
p.title.text_color = "Purple"
p.title.text_font_size = "20px"
p.title.background_fill_color = "Thistle"


show(p)
source.1e1ce1be:
from bokeh.models import Title

# size of figure, the position of toolbar
p = figure(width=400, height=400, toolbar_location="above") 

# data 
x = [1,3,5,]
y = [6,5,7,9]
x1 =[2,1,6,]
y1 = [1,5,3,4]

# color of patches, alpha of patches, width of line
p.patches([x, y], [x1, y1],
          color=["MediumOrchid", "Purple"], 
                   alpha=[0.8, 0.3], 
                   line_width=2)

# name, position, color, size of title; color and position of title background
p.add_layout(Title(text="Sample-Bottom", 
                   align="center",
                   text_color = 'Purple', 
                   text_font_size = '20px',
                   background_fill_color = 'Thistle'), "below")



show(p)
